Daniel, could you provide the log entries for the first session?

According to this message, during shutdown in the previous session, some plugins
were not stopped properly. When that happens, the OSGi framework tries to start
them up right away (not following Eclipse rules where pre-requisites must be
activated first). We prevent that from happening, and log it for debugging
purposes (it should never happen), but other than the log entries, everything
should work fine. Was this the case?

Rafael,

I included the whole .log (I think).
Yes, everything worked from a user's perspective. I only saw that there was a
.log being generated.

Looks like we need some better error reporting on shutdown.  

Check out for M8
I am getting this every time I start one of my workspaces. Investigating...

More info on this:

- no text editors open, file buffers is not active
- a search view is open, search is active
- during shutdown, Search is causing the activation of the FileBuffers plugin:

SearchPlugin.shutdown()->
InternalSearchUI.getInstance() ->
InternalSearchUI.init() ->
PositionTracker class must be loaded ->
IFileBuffer and other classes from org.eclipse.core.filebuffers must be loaded,
causing activation 

- our bundle stopper does not include non-active bundles in the list of bundles
to be stopped, so filebuffers is activated, and we don't stop it (it is stopped
later by the start level service, which remembers this and tries to start it
automatically on next startup).

As per bug 58879, auto-activation is being disabled during shutdown, so this is
not an issue anymore.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 58879 ***

traces.message: Legacy plug-in "org.eclipse.core.filebuffers" must not be automatically activated on startup. This is probably caused by a previous crash in Eclipse.
Legacy plug-in "org.eclipse.core.filebuffers" must not be automatically activated on startup. This is probably caused by a previous crash in Eclipse.
